summary: This is an FBI Task Force Officer's affidavit in support of an application for a search warrant to search 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The affidavit details the seizure of devices from Epstein's person, his New York residence, and his Virgin Islands residence, and establishes probable cause to search them for evidence of sex trafficking, enticement, transportation of minors, and conspiracy, involving Epstein and his associates, including Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the investigation, indicted for sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. Devices were seized from his person and his residences. He died in August 2019 while in custody.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a potential co-conspirator who helped facilitate and participate in Epstein's abuse of minors, including transportation and enticement. Her communications and involvement are a focus of the expanded search.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the indictment arrest warrant for Epstein and several search warrants for the New York residence and seized discs.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: Signed the search warrant application on June 26, 2020.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Signed the Fourth Search Warrant for the New York residence on July 11, 2019.

persons.name: Kevin Nathaniel Fox
persons.context: Signed the Fifth Search Warrant for devices seized from Epstein and the suitcase on July 14, 2019.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Signed the Sixth Search Warrant for the Virgin Islands residence on August 11, 2019.

persons.name: James L. Cott
persons.context: Signed the Seventh Search Warrant for devices from the Virgin Islands on September 12, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney on the sealed indictment against Epstein.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Listed as the AUSA on the arrest warrant for Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator who facilitated Epstein's abuse of minors, including transportation, enticement, and participation in group sexualized massages.
Employee-1, a New York-based employee, scheduled victims' encounters with Epstein at his New York residence.
Employee-2, an assistant, scheduled victims' encounters in Florida and is a Target Subject of the ongoing investigation. Epstein wired $250,000 to her in December 2018.
Employee-3, an assistant, scheduled victims' encounters with Epstein and traveled to the Virgin Islands.
Individual-4 emailed Maxwell in 2004 about identifying 'beautiful, talented young women' for Epstein in exchange for payments.
Individual-5 emailed Maxwell in 2002 and 2003 asking about finding 'new inappropriate friends' and arranging for girls on trips.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI at Teterboro Airport upon arrival from France. Two electronic devices (iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of New York Residence (9 East 71st Street)
events.description: Law enforcement executed search warrants at Epstein's New York mansion, finding a massage room with sex toys, nude photographs, and numerous compact discs and electronic devices.

events.title: Second Search of New York Residence and Recovery of Suitcases
events.description: A search warrant was executed, discovering the safe was empty. An employee stated they had removed the contents to suitcases per a Third Party's instruction. The suitcases were recovered, containing hard drives (Subject Device-3).

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and pronounced dead.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James, Virgin Islands
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search warrant at Epstein's private island, seizing 27 electronic devices from various structures.

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell began abusing Minor Victim-1 when she was approximately 14, including sexual abuse in New York and Florida and group sexualized massages.

events.title: $250,000 Wire Transfer to Employee-2
events.description: Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to Employee-2 days after the Miami Herald published articles about his sexual misconduct, suggesting an attempt to influence a potential witness.

events.title: Revision of Epstein's Will
events.description: Epstein amended his will to bequeath $10,000,000 to Ghislaine Maxwell and forgive loans to Employee-2, changing bequests from a February 2019 version.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York Residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
Palm Beach, Florida (location of another Epstein residence mentioned in indictment)
keyFacts: The affidavit seeks to expand the search of 62 seized electronic devices to include evidence of additional crimes (enticement and transportation of minors) and to specifically target evidence related to Ghislaine Maxwell and other co-conspirators.

Searches of Epstein's New York residence revealed a 'massage room' with sex toys and thousands of nude/partially nude photographs of girls, many appearing to be under 18, stored on compact discs with labels like 'Young [Name]', 'Nudes 00-24', 'Girl Pics Nude', 'Zorro' (New Mexico ranch), and 'LSJ' (Little Saint James).

Evidence indicates Epstein's abuse of minors started earlier than previously charged (as early as 1994) and that Ghislaine Maxwell participated in facilitating and engaging in that abuse, including with Minor Victim-1.

After the initial search of the New York residence, an employee removed contents from a safe into suitcases at the direction of a third party; these were later recovered by the FBI, showing attempts to remove potential evidence.
Communications extracted from seized devices show Maxwell discussing with others the recruitment of 'young women' or 'girls' for Epstein and other individuals, indicating a broader network.
